name: accessibility
description: The accessibility_for_disabilities table contains details of the arrangements for access to locations for people who have disabilities

id.name: id
id.title: Identifier
id.description: The identifier for this accessibility information. Each entry must have a unique identifier.

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.title: Location Identifier
location_id.description: The identifier of the location for which the entry describes the accessibility provision

description.name: description
description.title: Description
description.description: Description of assistance or infrastructure that facilitate access to clients with disabilities.
description.example: The building is equipped with induction loops for hearing aids. Wheelchair access is possible on all levels.

details.name: details
details.title: Details
details.description: Any further details relating to the relevant accessibility arrangements at this location. E.g. whether advance notice is required to use an accessibility facility.
details.example: Switch hearing aid to T-coil to access the induction loop facility.

url.name: url
url.title: URL
url.description: URL of a page giving more information about the accessibility of the location

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: The services attributes table creates a link between a service and one or more classifications that describe the nature of the service provided.

metadata.name: metadata
metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata table contains a record of the changes that have been made to the data in order to maintain provenance information.
